snippet: A military appeals court halted proceedings to allow it time to rule on whether the judge can order Maj. Nidal Malik Hasan, accused of killing 13 people in a 2009 shooting rampage, to be forcibly shaved.
abstract: Military appeals court halts proceedings in trial of Maj Nidal Malik Hasan, accused of killing 13 people in 2009 shooting rampage at Fort Hood Army base, while it decides whether Hasan can be forcibly shaved for his trial; he grew beard to show his Muslim faith, but it violates Army regulations and he has been kept from courtroom during pretrial hearings as a result; prosecutors charge that Hasan grew the beard to prevent witnesses from identifying him at trial.
lead_paragraph: A military appeals court halted proceedings to allow it time to rule on whether the judge can order Maj. Nidal Malik Hasan, accused of killing 13 people in a 2009 shooting rampage, to be forcibly shaved.

headline.main: Fort Hood Shooting Trial Delayed Pending Ruling on Beard
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Delays Trial in Fort Hood Shooting to Rule on Question of Beard
